intro: Dichapetalum brachysepalum, commonly known as the short-sepaled dichapetalum, is a rare and striking plant native to the tropical rainforests of western Africa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals and prominent stamens. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
